issues.title: Hardcoded Pixel Values
issues.description: The CSS uses hardcoded pixel values (e.g., `left: 100px`, `top: 20px`, `width: 100px`, etc.) for positioning and sizing elements. This makes the layout inflexible and difficult to adapt to different screen sizes or resolutions.

issues.title: Inconsistent Styling
issues.description: The `#camera` and `#delete-me` elements share some styling (font family, size) but are defined separately.  This is redundant and makes maintenance harder.  Consider consolidating styles into reusable classes.

issues.title: Unclear ID `delete-me`
issues.description: The ID `delete-me` is not descriptive and doesn't convey the element's purpose.  A more meaningful ID would improve code readability and maintainability.

issues.title: Missing Units for `height: 100%` on `#canvas`
issues.description: The `height: 100%` for the `#canvas` element might not work as expected without specifying the unit (e.g., `height: 100vh`).  The current code relies on the parent element having a defined height.

feedback: The CSS code is functional but lacks flexibility and could be improved in terms of maintainability and readability.
